name: Great Love Songs Trivia Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: "When I Said I Do" was recorded by Clint Black, who is the woman that sings this song with him?
questions.explanation:
Lisa Hartman Black.

	On the "Top 100 Love Songs" on Country Music Television, Lisa Hartman Black originally did not want to sing this song with her husband.  She felt a singer should sing it, not an actress.  However, Clint Black felt the only person that could sing this song with him was his wife, as that was who he said "I do" too. She agreed and the song became a hit.

questions.text: Andrew Lloyd Webber wrote "Love Changes Everything" for one of his musicals. Which show was it?
questions.explanation:
Aspects of Love.

	"Aspects of Love" opened on Broadway in 1990 and closed in 1991. Michael Ball, Sarah Brightman who were both in the original cast have hits with this song. Michael Crawford, who has worked with Webber in another show (Phantom of the Opera) also had a hit with this song.

questions.text: The Beatles have made a lot of love songs. One of my favorites includes the lyric: "Oh please, say to me. You'll let me be your man." What song is this lyric from?
questions.correct: I Want to Hold Your Hand
questions.explanation:
I Want to Hold Your Hand.

	John Lennon and Paul Mc Cartney wrote "I Want to Hold Your Hand" in 1963. It was their first song to make it to number one on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart. They also recorded the song in German with the title "Komm, Gib Mir Deine Hand" which translates as "Come, Give Me Your Hand". Information found at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Want_to_Hold_Your_Hand

questions.text: Sometimes love songs are not about romantic love, but other types of love. The song "Beautiful Boy" is about one of John Lennon's sons. Which one was this song written about?
questions.explanation:
Sean.

	"Beautiful Boy" was one of the last songs John Lennon recorded before his death. It contains the famous line "Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans." At the end of the song, he mentions Sean by name leaving no doubt to the listeners who this song was written for.

questions.text: Even the cartoons can have good love songs. In the Disney movie "Beauty and the Beast" the title song was sang by Angela Lansbury who played Mrs. Potts.  But on the credits at the end, who sang it with Celine Dion?
questions.explanation:
Peabo Bryson.

	"Beauty and the Beast" the Disney version, came out in 1991. It then opened a few years later in 1994 on Broadway. The show and the song, show that people who are very different can still find love in each other.

questions.text: Who had a hit with the song "Here and Now"?
questions.explanation:
Luther Vandross.

	Luther Vandross' song "Here and Now" was written in 1990. Sadly, Luther died on July 1, 2005. According to wikipedia, the cause of his death is disputed.

questions.text: Stevie Wonder's love song "I Just Called to Say I Love You" is about a person who calls for no other special occasion other than to tell the person on the other end of the line "I Love You". What is the first event he mentions in this song?
questions.explanation:
New Year's Day.

	The first verse of the song says: "No New Years Day to celebrate, No chocolate covered candy hearts to give away, No first of spring, no song to sing, In fact, here's just another ordinary day. " The song was written and produced and sung by Stevie Wonder.  It won him Golden Globe and Academy Award for Best Original song.

questions.text: Which Temptations love song title, was used for the title of a movie with Macaulay Culkin and Anna Chlumsky?
questions.explanation:
My Girl.

	"My Girl" was recorded in 1964 by the Temptations. It was their first US number one single. It was written by Smokey Robinson for his wife, and he originally intended to have his own group The Miracles perform it.

questions.text: What artist had a hit with the beautiful song "Through the Years"?
questions.explanation:
Kenny Rogers.

	Kenny Rogers had a hit in 1981 with "Through the Years" which looks at life with someone through all the good and bad times. He concludes the song by declaring "As long as it's okay. I'll stay with you, through the years."

questions.text: What beautiful country song includes the lyrics: "Your hair all around me. Baby you surround me."?
questions.explanation:
"Amazed" by Lonestar.

	"Amazed" was number one on the country charts for eight weeks. It crossed over and was number 24 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart as well.
